string.text: Get the artifact.
Protect the Stalkers' camp at the Garbage from bandits' assault.
Protect the Stalkers' camp at the Garbage from bandits' assault.

A group of Stalkers is coming to visit me, and I am personally interested in their safe arrival. They'll stay not far from the Bar. One penitent criminal element almost voluntary informed us that they are going to be attacked soon. So, head in that direction and protect their camp from the assault.
Help Stalkers fight off the bandits at Agroprom.
Help Stalkers fight off the bandits at Agroprom.

So here's the deal. Recently a group of Stalkers went to Agroprom. The last time they contacted us, they said that there was something valuable in the underground, but they were pressed hard by the bandits. They're holding on, but they can't clear the bandits out. Will you help the stalkers?
Eliminate the bandits at the Garbage.
Wipe out the bandit gang that settled at the Garbage. It has to be a quick and efficient operation.

A job, eh? Let's see what we've got... Aha! Here you go: can you knock out that pack of bandits at the Garbage? The Duty, with all their speeches about law and order, just can't get down to it. Those are some rare scumbags, so they won't last long anyway. But the guy who gets them first will score big... and the booze is on me, of course.
Eliminate the Mercs and bandits in Rostok.
Destroy the group of Mercs and bandits that block the passage through Rostok.

There's a gang of Mercs not far away, in Rostok. They hit it off with the bandits, so now they're scheming to block the passage through the plant. I don't need to tell you what a pain in the ass it is, and it's got to be resolved right away. The Duty guys and some of the old-timers have already gone to teach them a lesson, but we haven't heard from them in a while... So why don't you... Eh... Go and "check" on the mercs? The money's good, too.
Eliminate the bandits at the farmstead.
It's all simple: clear the farmstead of bandits.

There's the farmstead by the old warehouses. Used to be a perfect place for a rendezvous... to exchange goods, you know, that sort of thing. But now the bandits have occupied it and, by the looks of it, they are not about to bug out. Now, that doesn't suit me at all. I need this farmstead ASAP. I don't care what happens to the lodgers.
Purge the bandits' camp at Wild Territory.
Purge the bandits' camp at Wild Territory.
There are bandits at the Wild Territory. We can't let these dregs of society spread their filth right near the Bar. It's essential to wipe out their camp.
Destroy the lair of wild mutant dogs at the Wild Territory.
Destroy the lair of wild mutant dogs at the Wild Territory.

A few of our guys went on an expedition, and just one came back. All torn up, bloody, glassy eyes. Ran into dogs, most likely. There's a whole pack of them there. Go find their lair and kill every last one of them.
Destroy the group of bandits at the Agroprom.
Destroy the group of bandits at the Agroprom.

I remember how in '94 the racketeers latched on to me - "cough it up," they said. Man, I went through hell then; I had a restaurant and all. Back then, I couldn't prove a case against them! And now I find out that the same gang's working in the Agroprom, making a profit off of the artifacts they find there. But here I can do something. I even know exactly where they're hiding. Do me a favor: punish them.
Destroy the lair of snorks in the Dark Valley.
Destroy the lair of snorks in the Dark Valley.

Yeah... It seems that the ones who say that the Zone is expanding are right. They spotted a few snorks in the Dark Valley, and they never used to see them there before. Now they're starting to panic. The Duty guys promised to destroy the snorks, but they can't seem to get around to doing it. Will you take it on?
Find the Meat Chunk artifact.
Find the Meat Chunk artifact that heals ailments and injuries.

Some padres have stopped by, left an order for a Meat Chunk. You know, they have a certain interest in this healing artifact... Those rotten miracle-workers! Anyway... You gonna do it? It's up to you.
Find the Crystal Thorn artifact.
Find the Crystal Thorn artifact that protects against psi-attacks.

A "crone"? No, that's not it. "Crystal corn"?. No, wrong again... Shit! "Crystal Thorn," that's it! So here's the deal: I have an order for this artifact, "Crystal Thorn." Have you heard of it? They say that if you've got one, it helps drain away radiation. So what do you say?
Find the Night Star artifact.
Find the Night Star artifact to help the national military research effort.

I need the Night Star artifact. I'm sorry to say it doesn't grant any wishes - been there, done that - but it CAN make you wealthy. Scientists pay a lot for it. They say they make some military things out of it... So, are you up for it?
Find the Flash artifact.
Find the Flash artifact.
The assignment is simple and the pay is good. You have to find the Flash artifact. Don't even ask who ordered it or why. Well, will you do it?
Find the Goldfish artifact.
Find the Goldfish artifact.

Marked One, you know the fairytale about the Goldfish? Yeah, yeah, that's the one. There are a bunch of jokes about it, too. So anyway, there's this old man who keeps on wanting to catch it. Bottom line, I need the one-of-a-kind artifact called Goldfish. The client is from the outside, respectable. Will you help out?
Find the Meat chunk artifact again
Find the Meat chunk artifact again.
Find the Meat chunk artifact again and I will remove the bad effects for you.
Find the Crystal Thorn artifact again
Find the Crystal Thorn artifact again.
Find the Crystal Thorn artifact again and I will remove the bad effects for you.
Find the Night Star artifact again
Find the Night Star artifact again.
Find the Night Star artifact again and I will remove the bad effects for you.
Find the artifact Flash again
Find the artifact Flash again.
Find the artifact Flash again and I will remove the bad effects for you.
Find artifact Goldfish again
Find artifact Goldfish again.
Find artifact Goldfish again and I will remove the bad effects for you.
Find psi-suit.
Find the suit that provides efficient protection against psi-emissions. The place to look for it is the deserted labs in the Dark Valley.

In those labs in the Dark Valley, they were trying to find a way to protect human brains from psi-emissions. They were taking their sweet fucking time, that's for sure... Anyway, one of their attempts actually was a success, and there's supposed to be this suit somewhere that you can wear and even kiss the Controller. Yep, it's that good. So if you get me this little bauble, I'll never forget it.
Find the foreigner's gun.
An interesting assignment. The name rings a bell... But where do I know him from?

There once was this foreigner in our neck of the woods... Gordon was his name, I think. His whole manner was that of an experienced Stalker, but he said he'd never been to the Zone. But anyway, that's not the point. He vanished somewhere in the Zone eventually. But he had this sweet piece, a Desert Eagle. If I could just take a closer look at it...
Find the modified VSS Vintorez.
Find the modified VSS Vintorez. Apparently, the place to look is the Red Forest area.

There was this odd story. This one dude pops up, pockets full of dough, and sets off hiring himself a gang - not the old-timers though, but more of the nippy type. Bought tons of gear... I had this one cherry VSS Vintorez, a marvelous gun! - so I was fool enough to sell it to him. I won't lie to you, I made quite a bit of money... Except his whole crew got knocked out close to the Red Forest. What can I say? They died for nothing. Well, a good lesson for all to learn: you can't pave your way through the Zone with money. Anyhow, I can't stop thinking about that Vintorez, such a bad-ass gun rusting somewhere! Will you find it for me? I'm paying good money!
Find Farshooter SVDm-2
There is a SVDm-2 Farshooter hidded somewhere in Military's Warehouse area.
Find your clothing worned out? I can enhance a Stalker outfit for you if you can bring one.
Kill the soldier.
A certain soldier needs to be sent to Valhalla. The job should be a piece of cake, except... something's weird; the target's just a man in uniform. The customer really has his dander up too.
I need you to take down this grunt... Don't ask questions on this one; just do it. So? Can I entrust you with it?
Kill the Stalker.
Do in one of the Stalkers. Death to the cheater, that's the trader's revenge.

You know, there's this type of man that you could never say a bad word about... You trust him as you trust yourself, right? You bank on him... But suddenly you find out that he is the vilest, meanest son of a bitch... So here's the deal: there's this one case that needs to get sorted out. Do it, and I'll take care of the rest.
Kill the Stalker from the Monolith group.
Find trader's ex-friend and help him die.

I used to have a friend... Hard to believe, eh? We came to the Zone together when none of this stuff was here... The things we used to do, the places we used to go to... Oh well, we were young, didn't give a damn about anything. But he could never get enough. He wanted to go to the center of the Zone and was talking me into it, but I refused, and did the right thing. We had a really bad fight, and he left on his own... And now I hear someone saw him there - and he's with Monolith now. So the deal is, Marked One... As a friend, do this for me, find him and... Well, don't make him suffer, it must be bad enough... He was like a brother to me, you know?
Kill the Stalker called Vampire.
Find and kill the Stalker called Vampire.

That's it, I've had enough of this shitbag! I mean Vampire, do you know him? That bastard! Sucking luck out of people instead of blood. Anyone goes into the Zone with him, they die, all to a man, but he always comes back safe and sound! Done it five times now! That's evil, don't you think? I'd love to put a stake in this Vampire... So, will you take the job?
Kill the Stalker called Sparrow.
Find Sparrow and avenge the death of another Stalker.

Damn musketeers! Playing D'Artagnan, assholes! As if tiptoeing around anomalies and dodging bullets isn't enough, the oafs have now taken to fighting duels! Get this: there was this fight... No one can even remember any more what started it. So these two dickheads decided to settle it with blood. And there you go, one dropped dead... A fine Stalker he was, too! And the other one, Sparrow, bugged out, because I'd be the first one to put a bullet in his head. Find him. I'm sure he's still in the Zone. Will you do it?
Obtain the flesh's eye.
Obtain the flesh's eye.

An outside client wants to have a "Zone party" soon. There'll be a fancy dinner, and the invited gourmets who will be in especially "high spirits" will be served a special recipe - eyes of "flesh" under a mutant sauce. That is, in its own juices under mayonnaise. Basically, I need the eye of that beast, and quickly.
Bring the hoof of a boar.
Bring the hoof of a boar.

Did you know that we can make money from mutant horns and hooves? This is a big rarity outside the zone, and they make expensive jewelry from the local mutated hooves. I know a jeweler; he's interested. So go on, find the boar's hoof, and there'll be cash in your pocket.
Protect Duty's security post.
Protect Duty's security post at the Garbage.

So, you probably ran into our guys at the Garbage. They're there as a sort of an exterior post protecting the Bar from mutants coming down from the Dark Valley. Information has come in that a sick herd of boar is approaching them. Help them fight off the mutants, and I'll owe you one.
Destroy the zombie.
Destroy the zombie Stalkers at Yantar.

Recently we sent a group to Yantar. Unfortunately, nobody from the group returned. I was informed that they saw a few zombied Stalkers from the group not far from the mobile lab of the scientists at Yantar. We can't allow them to remain in that horrible state. Your assignment: find them and destroy what they've become.
Get rid of the pack of dogs.
Get rid of the pack of dogs at the Garbage.

Normally, we don't give assignments to foreign Stalkers. On the other hand, this is a simple task, so there's no point making our guys do it. So listen. You need to purge a small lair of beasts at the Garbage. One of our groups is already working there, so in case of trouble you'll have a place to retreat to. On the other hand, there shouldn't be any problems because there aren't many beasts there - not more than ten. Most likely dogs: recently there were reports of a migration of a large pack of them in the area. You can get to carrying out the assignment.
Destroy the Stalkers' camp.
Destroy the Salkers' camp at Agroprom.

There's one delicate matter, and our guys definitely shouldn't be involved in it. The presence of neutrals on the factory at Agroprom isn't advantageous for our allies. Here's the assignment: free the area from the presence of Stalkers, no matter who they are and what group they belong to. Understood?
Destroy the detachment of Mercs.
Destroy the detachment of Mercs at Rostok.

So here's the assignment: you need to destroy a detachment of snipers of the Mercs group. The situation: these snipers are holding the top floor of the building site complex. Scouts report not less than two, not more than five. They're armed with sniper rifles. Suggestion: don't show your face there during the day.
Protect the bandits' base.
Protect the bandits' main base in the Dark Valley.

It is imperative to raid the bandits' main base and destroy them. Their base is in the Dark Valley, where there's an unfinished science center. The enemy numbers thirty fighters, armed with light automatic weapons, guns, shotguns. Everything clear?
Eliminate the snorks.
Eliminate the snorks in the tunnels in the Yantar sector.
This time you'll need to do some serious purging. The tunnels at Yantar are simply swarming with snorks, around ten of them. Yeah, you wouldn't want to try to wait out a storm in those tunnels now...
Destroy the herd of fleshes.
Destroy the herd of fleshes at the Wild Territory.

We tracked the migration of a large herd of beasts... Quite disgusting, pig-like mutants that everyone calls "fleshes". Now they're in the area of the Garbage. All of our people are busy, but these beasts need to be destroyed. It's a special kind of job - we'll pay.
Destroy the pseudodogs.
Purge the lair of pseudodogs by the military warehouses.

Our allies have notified us about the discovery of a lair of monsters on the territory by the military warehouses. We believe it's a pack of pseudodogs. We shouldn't be messing around in that area right now, so it's an assignment for a neutral. Are you in?
Destroy the security post of the Mercs.
Destroy the security post of the Mercs not far from the military warehouses.

Lately there's been an increase in the activity of groups of Mercs. There's been a few attacks on the scientists and researchers working in the zone. We can't let that continue. We need to carry out a small punitive operation. The goal: the security post of the Mercs by the military warehouses, behind the abandoned village.
Destroy the Mercs in the Wild Territory.
Destroy the Mercs in the Wild Territory.

A group of scientists is planning to study the Wild Territory. But lately it hasn't been safe there; the Mercs have taken an interest in the area. Make sure that there aren't any more Mercs in the Wild Territory.
Kill the bandits.
Kill the bandits who got into the Wild Territory.
I'll make this short. The bandits got around our security posts at the Bar and are now located in the Wild Territory. They need to be eliminated.
Destroy the Controller
Destroy the Controller at Yantar.

To carry out this assignment you need to have special skills. The scientists have reported to us that they noticed a Controller at Yantar, by the entrance to the underground lab in the center building. Controllers are very dangerous, but I'm sure you'll manage.
Purge the Freedom members.
Purge the abandoned village not far from the military warehouses from the Freedom members.

There's been an increase in the activity of the Freedom patrol in the abandoned village by the military warehouses. Purge the village of the fighters. After carrying out this assignment a special reward awaits you.
Destroy the bandits.
Destroy the bandits at the Garbage.

The current situation is unfavorable. The bandits are gathering in the areas of the Garbage and the Dark Valley. The best solution is to carry out two preemptive strikes at the same time! Our fighters will take on the valley, and you'll take on Garbage.
Find the enhanced rifle.
Find the sample of enhanced ZM LR300 near the military warehouses.

Someone's backing the Mercs. Quite recently they got equipped with machine-guns, enhanced for sniper fire. You understand how dangerous such a weapon is? Well, I'm interested in one of these guns too. My gratitude will be great, for sure.
Neutralize the bandit.
Neutralize the bandit Poker.

Subject's nickname: Poker. One of the most cruel bandit leaders, a thug and a rapist... Evidently, his head is not okay: they say he caught a rare disease in the Zone. Now he suffers quite frequent lapses of memory, goes on a rampage, and when he gains consciousness, he can't remember who and where he is. Nevertheless, he's always armed and very aggressive. Presumed location: Dark Valley. Ready for the task?
Neutralize the Monolith leader.
Neutralize the Monolith leader at Pripat.
A big reward for a bad guy. Why not.
Find the weapon of the Duty member.
The Duty member is asking you to find his weapon; he lost it somewhere in the Dark Valley during another scouting expedition.

Shouldn't have freaked out like that. The Zone fucks with your head. Thought I had good nerves, never afraid of anything, and now this... This howling in my ears. Everything was going as usual. There was a scouting expedition to the Dark Valley. We got down into the trench with Krivoi to cover the rest of the group, and then once I heard the howling, I was gripped by fear. Damn, I don't even remember how I got to the coordinates. When I returned to the base, Voronin almost shot me on the spot: he had just given me an enhanced cannon, for good service, so to speak. And here... I panicked and took off so fast that I left the cannon there. Could you bring it back for me, or else where will I go now without a decent weapon?
Purge the lair of the snorks.
Destroy the lair of the snorks at Yantar.

I want to offer you a small amount of money that you'll receive if the snorks living in the swamps will stop bothering me and my colleagues. Sometimes when we're carrying out our experiments, we can't even concentrate.
Destroy the lair of wild dogs.
Purge the lair or wild dogs in the Wild Territory.

There's a lair of mutant dogs at the Wild Territory; I want you to travel there and clear it up. These mutants are particularly dangerous for our expeditions. I know some biologists won't favor this solution, but it is for the best, as they must admit. Such beasts spread rabies, plague and God knows what else.
Bring the Fireball artifact.
Bring the Fireball artifact to the scientists for research.

We've managed to produce a rare artifact in laboratory conditions! This is a breakthrough! Soon all the world will hear about our success. And the Nobel Prize will be close at hand! We have produced the unique artifact "Pellicle," which has as its main quality protection from chemical burns. I want to give one to you so you can experience the benefit from our research! I do have one request, however: in exchange, I need the artifact "Fireball." Will you get one? The unique thermal qualities of its surface require thorough research!
Find the "Gravi" artifact.
Bring the "Gravi" artifact to the hands of the scientists.

We're approaching a new comprehension of the nature of gravitation! Perhaps soon, we will be able to create a new generation of engines based on antigravity, and quite probably even the path to the stars will be opened to us! For that, we need another "Gravi" artifact to continue our research, and fast.
Find the "Jellyfish" artifact.
The scientists need the "Jellyfish" artifact to carry out research in the field of space-time.

Our research team is on the brink of discovering the mysteries of space-time! The possibility of teleportation may no longer be just fantasy! The Vortex is an anomaly which squeezes space itself, rather than just gravitationally affecting objects -- as some of my ossified opposing-theorists believe, while they sit in a warm research facility earnestly chewing chalk. Their glasses will fog up when they find out what results science can achieve when you work in the field! Please get me the artifact "Jellyfish."
Find the "Moonlight" artifact.
Provide "Moonlight" to the scientists at Yantar. A good artifact...

We desperately need materials for continuing our research in the field of energetics! You see, we have learned to generate enormous quantities of energy with the help of artifacts. Granted, this only works while the KPD isn't too high. We were able to get the best results with the artifact Moonlight. Please bring us a sample for more experiments!
Find the artifact called Sea Urchin.
The scientists need the Sea Urchin artifact to improve their suits.

You are probably aware that our suits provide the best defense against radiation. The secret lies in the fact that we saturate them with an extract made out of quite a rare artifact. To manufacture another series of these suits we need such an artifact. You call it "Sea Urchin."
Bring the unique bodysuit.
Bring the unusual bodysuit from the underground laboratory X16.

We have some business with you. Recently we hired a Stalker to get into the laboratory. Even then I noticed his unusual bodysuit - it gave off noticeable heat. The Stalker said that the bodysuit itself can heal wounds. Bottom line: the Stalker didn't return from the lab. Oh no; don't even think it! We had nothing to do with that! And his bodysuit is most likely still there. I would be very glad to get it for research.
Bring a part of the snork's body.
It's a piece of cake getting a fragment of a snork in these parts.

I got acquainted with Semenov back in the university where I was giving lectures on genetics, and he was my student. I became his scientific mentor. Back then, we were only lifting a corner of the curtain that hides the mystery of genome modification. So what was I saying? Oh, right. For our genetic experiments we will need the samples of fresh cells of the muscular tissue of the snork. You will have to search the bogs for this genetic material. There is a hypothesis that snorks as a species are the next level of human evolution. In order to know this for sure, a DNA test must be procured!
Bring the eye of a flesh.
I'd better keep my body away from these eggheads just in case! Very well, I'll get them a flesh's eye, and they can do all they want with their volunteers.

Good news, young man: we have a very interesting assignment for you! I think as an intellectual being with quite a bit of experience you will be able to appreciate my colleagues' theories. The thing is, our research revealed the eyes of the creatures called "flesh" in the common language, are equipped with... Are you following me? With olfactory receptors! Thus, they can not only see with their eyes, but smell with them as well! We're getting ready for an operation on transplanting this miraculous eye to one of... Uh, one of our voluntary assistants. I believe we're about to start a craze! By the way, would you like to become a recipient of this rather amazing organ?
Bring the tail of a blind dog.
Well, look at Science! Trying to find a second brain in humans? Poor dogs, one of them will have to do without a tail now.

Good day, colleague! I hope you know that dogs belong to the vertebrates subtype... Meaning their vertebral column starts with the head and ends with the tail. And here's the catch! One of my young collegues proved theoretically that the spine of the "blind dogs" - this is how you've named this type of animal - starts from the tail, not from the head! Think of it, it totally turns upside down our assumptions pertaining to this area of knowledge. There are already some rather daring theories about human beings having around their sacrum a... Well, this is a subject of many discussions. In short, we need the head of the dog, the blind dog, which through ignorance we considered to be its tail.
Bring the leg of a boar.
Gourmet thrillseekers... Alright, I'll get them some ham.

Welcome, uh... Traveler! I'm so glad you dropped by: we are in need of a man to take part in a highly important experiment. My colleague Brenter wants to research a diet using local fauna for a practical experiment to study the influence of mutated protein on the human body. For a start, we decided to try the boars. We need ham. A boar's leg, do you undestand? And if you agree to do it, please select the healthiest specimen.
Bring the bloodsucker's jaw.
What they are going to do with bloodsucker's jaw, I don't care. I care about how much they will give me for this rarity.

Oh, Stalker, glad to see you! Listen, you have already met bloodsuckers in the Zone, right? If not, then we want you to make that happen. Bring us the lower jaw of a representative of this species, with all his so-called "cutlery." Unfortunately, I can't disclose the details of the experiment; besides, it might negatively impact the stability of your psyche. We'll be waiting.
Camp elimination.
Find the item.
Protect the Stalkers at Agroprom.
Fight off the bandits' attack on the Stalkers' camp at Agroprom.

There's a group of Stalkers living at the Agroprom. Average Joes - they understand that the Zone is a place of freedom, that laws don't apply here, and you just have to live right, based on your own morals. And now they're thinking about maybe joining us. So, help them fight off the bandits, and we'll send you some ammo.
Protect border.
Protect the border near the Army warehouses from monsters.
Here come the monsters again from the side of the Scorcher. Help the guys at the border hold them off. I guarantee a reward.
Destroy the military camp.
Destroy the military camp by the Agroprom Research Institute.

The military are staging a gradual Zone takeover. We need to slow them down; otherwise, the Zone will turn into a research zoo. One of the military camps is right by the Agroprom. If you manage to shoot up the place a bit, it will slow down Zone's takeover by the Army.
Destroy the Merc camp.
Destroy the Merc camp by the warehouses.

Listen, here's the deal. The Merc camp needs to be destroyed. We could leave them be, they're good shots... 'Cept they've been really asking for it, sneaking into our territory, trying to bribe my people. It's time to teach them a lesson. Can you do it?
Destroy the Duty detachment.
Destroy the clean-up Duty faction in Rostok.

How 'bout going on a hunt? Duty's clean-up detachment showed up at Rostok. This is a great chance to take them by surprise. Duty keeps sending guys hunting for the monsters, but in the process they don't hesitate to shoot whoever isn't up to their standards. This detachment needs to be finished off before Duty comes to Rostok. There shouldn't be too many people: three or four veterans and a couple of rookies.
Destroy the Duty outpost.
Destroy the Duty outpost at the Garbage as soon as possible.

There's a very urgent job. The passage from the Garbage to the Bar needs to be cleared of the Duty unit... They've taken to hiding there and robbing the passers-by. We're expecting a very important package, but now it must not be ruled out that Duty already knows about our courier and will try to waylay him. We need to wipe out this roadblock, even if for a little while. OK?
Clear the village.
Clear the village of bloodsuckers and, if possible eliminate the Controller.

Man, will you look at all those bloodsucking monsters swarming in the village! No one gets within a hundred meters of it, except complete morons. And some say they've been seeing things there... A fucking Controller is all we need right now! Anyway, it's high time we put an end to it. I'm not forcing you - to tell you the truth, I wouldn't go there myself. But if you're not afraid, then my gratitude won't have any bounds.
Destroy the herd of boars and fleshes,
Destroy the herd of boars and fleshes by the military warehouses.

Our sniper sits at the entrance to the base. He sits there on the tower at night... It's quiet, night-time... And suddenly there's an explosion, wild screeching, a flash! What the fuck?! It turns out, boars and fleshes got into the habit of wandering around by the minefield. God knows what makes them go there, but sure enough, at least once a week one of those beasts gets blown up by a mine. The assignment is simple - kill all of those suckers off. Will you do it?
Destroy the herd of rodents.
Destroy the herd of rodents in the Wild Territory.

There are no rodents anywhere near our base, but those things can get anywhere. And just recently there were so many of them here - you wouldn't have believed it. Two months we dealt with them... So, we figured out where the rodents came from to our base. From the Wild Territory, you follow? There's a fear that these jumping rats will multiply and return. We need a man to take care of them for us. Will you go?
Steal the sniper rifle.
Steal the modified Dragunov from the Duty warehouse.

There is a special assignment. And pretty tough, too... So, you'll need to retrieve an improved Dragunov from the Duty warehouse. This piece even has a name of its own, but never mind. The main thing is that with its awesome scope and recoil canceller you can shoot the nuts off a gnat from 400 meters. So, I trust you'll do it!
Obtain the modified Winchester 1300.
Obtain the modified Winchester 1300 from the scientists.

I hear the eggheads managed to improve the Winchester shotgun by using an artifact. The knockdown power of this thing is the same as a friggin' howitzer! So why don't you pay them a visit and see if you can make a bargain? I'll make up for all expenses!
Bring the bulletproof vest.
Bring the new model of the bulletproof vest.

Some of the grunts are sporting a new type of bulletproof vests. The inside lining is soaked in some healing ointment or some shit like that... Anyway, it makes small wounds heal up very fast. And imagine what luck: just the other day ten of those guys ran into Yantar, and only six returned, with three on their shoulders. You follow the math? One of them got left behind. If you get us his bullteproof vest, we'll examine it and make us a lot of them, too.
Kill Duty's security chief.
Kill Duty's security chief and try do it as quietly as possible.

It would be good for Duty's security chief to quietly disappear. And when they're in deep shit about that, I'll be able to plant a few of my guys in their gang. And then, the we'll be able to pull off any stunt... Alright, I better shut up. I suggest you take care of him from a distance, without kicking up a ruckus.
Kill Captain Ivantsov.
Kill Captain Ivantsov, the closest aide of the Duty leader.

It's a tough job, I'm warning you right away, but it's worth it. Ivantsov, a close aide of the Duty leader, has been asking for it. He does the dirtiest jobs: punitive operations, raids... If you only knew how many of our guys he's killed off! It's high time we did away with this asshole. So if you make up your mind to do it, I suggest you get yourself well-armed.
Kill Colonel Petrenko.
Kill Colonel Petrenko, one of the founders of the Duty faction.

Colonel Petrenko... I don't know if you've heard the name or met him, but it would be good for the two of you to meet. This man is one of the Duty founders and one of our worst enemies. Try to make sure your conversation ends as fast as possible... For him. Can you handle that?
Destroy the neutral Stalker.
Find and destroy the neutral Stalker.
There's a fellow who's walking around not far from here. He shot one of ours down once. And something like that can't be forgiven. Will you take the job? We'll pay, don't worry.
Kill one of the Duty commanders.
Kill one of the Duty commanders.
I'll pay for the head of any Duty leader! Knock one off and come back for reward.
Kill the Stalker called Scarecrow.
Eliminate the Stalker called Scarecrow.

We eliminate monsters as a matter of survival, not profit. Some individuals refuse to understand the difference, though. An apt illustration is the Stalker called Scarecrow. He got his nickname for a reason: selling stuffed mutants. His safaris are riling up the mutants on our turf and they're getting more savage than ever. We've warned him before, but all for nothing. So can you do a good deed for "Mother Earth?"
Kill the Stalker called Barin.
Kill the Stalker called Barin, chief quartermaster of the Duty faction.

A cad, bootlicker, hypocrite and yellow-bellied coward... that's Stalker Barin for you. This man's marvelous character helped him get to the top of Duty. He currently supplies their faction with supplies and rations, though he takes part in raids from time to time. We need to get rid of Barin, especially since all the Duty logistics go through him.
Kill the Duty leader.
Kill the Duty leader at the bar area.
You know, we are having the war with Duty. So if you can bring down it's leader. You get the best reward. You may say that someone else would take up the position. Well......
Bring a boar's leg.
Bring a boar's leg.
We're planning a victory celebration for pulling off a big raid. We could use a little help with supplies; why don't you get us some delicious ham?
Destroy the lair of the bloodsucker.
The hunter is asking to purge the lair of the bloodsucker in the village near the military warehouses, and in return he promises a rare artifact.

Have you ever run into a bloodsucker? Horrible thing, ain't it? Well, the other day I went to the village by the military warehouses, thought I'd look for some artifacts. And imagine this: suddenly I see a bloodsucker, black, and with scars all over. He's sitting over a corpse, doesn't see me. I freaked out and made a run for it. I shouldn't have started running, though, 'cause he heard me and went after me, and there was all this howling all around me and then I understood that he wasn't alone. I think they have a lair there! If you could chase them away from there, I would give you a rare artifact that I found a couple days ago.
Kill the Stalker.
Kill the traitor.
The Bald One wants you to kill one Stalker who took off with a very rare artifact.

A while ago another Stalker and I went looking for an artifact right next to the Scorcher. We found so much stuff, even found a couple of artifacts that I'd never seen before, not even in pictures. So that son of a bitch tricked me! During the last night, he snuck off and hid the most valuable artifacts. And then tried to tell me that they disappeared on their own! A couple days ago, I saw one of those very rare artifacts at the Barkeep's. I was so fucking pissed... Anyway, Stalker, if you could find him, send him a lead greeting from me. And while you're at it, maybe you can find out where his secret stash is and get the second artifact. It's worth it, believe me.
Kill master Stalker.
The Merc should pay for the assassination of each master. The fewer masters there are, the easier it is for the Mercs.

We don't like walking dreadnoughts wandering across the Zone - stalkers in exo-skeletons armed to the teeth. Our work becomes even more dangerous and harder with them around. The fewer of them there are, the better it is for us. Kill one of them and receive your reward.
Get a part of a monster body.
Destroy the Stalker from Freedom.
One Stalker, a former Duty member who had a lot of important information about objects at Pripyat, recently went over to the Freedom side. He needs to be killed before he says too much.

Listen here. We have maps of Pripyat - not up-to-date ones, but old ones, made in the early 90's. The most important thing on them is the marking of all military objects: underground warehouses, bomb shelters. Now there's little use for it, of course, but if we find a way through to Pripyat, this information will become priceless. Here's the problem, though. One of the officers went over to the Freedom side, and he knew about this information. He needs to be silenced before he says too much.
Come back for the reward.
Bring the customer what's been promised.
Find the perfected suit.
Nimble told us about the stash of the bandits where they hid the habar. He's asking to bring back the stolen suit, for a reward, of course.

While I was in captivity, I heard the bandits talking about their secret stash, where they keep the habar. Heard that they hid a cool coat there, and the next day some monster got his eye on the stash. He became so interested in it that now they're afraid to go there. Do me a favor, bring me the suit, and I'll pay you well.
I got zip at the moment.
And what do you want to talk about?
Great job, a reward well deserved!
What's up?
Look what we've got now:
Cover the Duty detachment from the attack of the bandits in the Dark Valley
Cover the Duty detachment from the attack of the bandits in the Dark Valley

I finally managed to get it into the thick heads of the Duty guys that it's high time to purge the Garbage of bandits. Duty will get to enlarge its territory and the bandits won't damage my regular clients as often. Well, here's the deal - the leadership of the Duty decided, for starters, to cut off the flow of bandits from the Dark Valley. So they sent out a blockade detachment and discovered that the bandits didn't like that. Who would have thought! So what I'm wondering is, could you help them secure the entrance to the Valley? I'll reward you handsomely.
There are no jobs available right now.
What do you want to discuss?
Good boy! Job well done.
I'm listening.
Here's the job update:
For the moment there's nothing.
What assignment do you want to talk about?
Assignment is complete - and here is the reward!
And what about the assignment?
There is something:
Sorry, but we don't have any jobs at the moment.
What is the job you would like to talk about?
You did a great job! Allow me to compensate you for your services...
I'm listening.
Here's what I can offer:
Destroy the bandit camp at the Garbage.
Eliminate the bandits at the Garbage who rob Stalkers on the way back from the Zone. The trader will be happy.

The bandits have rallied lately, getting in the way of honest people trading... So make a beeline for the Garbage. I've been told these shitbags have settled down near the scrapyard. You look into this matter, and everyone will be grateful to you and I'll be generous with the reward. Agreed?
Destroy the bandit camp at the auto park.
Eliminate the bandits at the auto park. Apparently, they're new to the Zone, so the job is gonna be easy.

The bandits have been hanging around the auto park again. So can you already guess what the job is about? Well then... Jump to it! Pass our warmest greetings to them and come back. I'll thank you then. Deal?
Eliminate the bandits by the Agroprom Research Institute.
Eliminate the bandits by the Agroprom Research Institute. Better stay on friendly terms with the trader.
Some bandits turned up by the Agroprom Research Institute. They're disturbing my diggers when they sort through the rubbish. You solve the problem, I'll owe you.
Purge the area of mutants.
Purge the area of mutants.

There is one thing, pretty easy. I want to bring some foreign tourist over. He paid some dough to my agents to get to look at the Zone. And the area where they're gonna show him around needs to be cleared of mutants. Will you do it?
Eliminate two bandits at the Garbage.
Make the road to one of the best places in the Zone accessible to all.

Recently one of the best places for lovers of the wonderful Zone became inaccessible. At the Garbage - yeah, the Garbage - there's a quaint little place like nowhere else, where all your sadness leaves you, where you can forget about the dirt, about money, about blood. Well, once you could forget, that is, because now there are two fucking freaks sitting there who threaten to kill anyone who doesn't pay them for being able to enter the place. Get rid of them - I have no other place to take the tourists.
Kill the bloodsucker in the Dark Valley.
Kill the bloodsucker in the Dark Valley.

They say that the troops left the Dark Valley. And then monsters started pouring out of every crevice. The Stalkers already spotted a bloodsucker there, and an extraordinary one at that - he's not afraid of open spaces. Anyway, once word gets around to the scientists, they'll definitely want to study this bloodsucker. And I want to be the person who hands them over the body. Your job is to kill the bloodsucker, and I'll take care of the rest.
Find the Jellyfish artifact.
Find the Jellyfish artifact formed in the Springboard anomaly.
Some guy from the Big Land asked for a Jellyfish. It's not a lot of money, but it's a milk run. Take it!
Find the Stone Flower artifact.
Find the Stone Flower artifact formed in the Springboard anomaly. The pay is supposed to be pretty good.

I have a request for the Stone Flower. The order is from the jewellers, by the way, so let's try to make the pretty ladies happy, eh? If you get it, you'll get the money and a bottle to drink to their health...
Find the Night Star artifact
Find the Night Star, a rare and expensive artifact.

There is this one little job... Rather unpleasant. Apparently, it's coming from the military - they're working on some new protection. Anyway, there's an order for the Night Star. It's quite a rare artifact, but it provides pretty good protection from bullets... So will you do it? I'll pay you well!
Find the artifact called Meat Chunk.
Find the wound-healing artifact called Meat Chunk
There's an order for an artifact, the kind that heals wounds, called "Meat Chunk!" Customers have a clinic of some sort. If you get it you'll get paid and help people at the same time.
Find another Jellyfish artifact.
Find another Jellyfish artifact, Sidorovich can remove the side effect.
If you have another Jellyfish. I can help remove the side effect.
Find another Wrenched artifact.
Find another Wrenched artifact, Sidorovich can remove the side effect.
If you have another Wrenched. I can help remove the side effect.
Find the perfected pistol.
Obtain the gun called "Fort" that supposedly has a larger number of rounds in its magazine. Its last known owner was the commander of the military checkpoint under the broken-down bridge.

Man, now there's a fad about using tricked-out weapons and nobody wants to shoot from normal weapons anymore, not even the newbies! Anyway, there's an order for an improved machine gun. Rumor has it the commander of the soldiers, the one who collects money for passing under the bridge, has a "Fort" with a fat mag. Will you get it?
Have a BM16 Modified
Sidorovich is a master of weapon and outfit enhancing. He can help you enhance your BM16.
Bring me a BM16 so I can put something more in it to make it stronger.
Have a MP5 Modified
Sidorovich is a master of weapon and outfit enhancing. He can help you enhance your MP5 with bigger magazine and more powerful ammos.
Bring me a MP5 so I can put something more in it to make it stronger. Like bigger magazine or so.
There's no jobs right now, really...
So what is it that you want to discuss?
Here's a fine young man! Excellent job, here's your money.
What's up?
Here's what I've got:
For the moment there's nothing.
What assignment do you want to talk about?
Assignment is complete - and here is the reward!
And what about the assignment?
There is something:
It's alright. Some other time.
I refuse to do this job.
Kill the bandit leader.
Kill the bandit leader who crossed the trader. Most likely he won't be alone... Tough job, but the pay covers it all. The Garbage is the place to look for him.

You'll have to finish off this one dandy, one of the bandit leaders. The other day the bandits, by his order, intercepted my courier and shook him up and I don't waste words with those who touch my people... In a word, if you get it done, I'll return the favor. So are you up for it?
Kill the trader Stalker.
Kill a Stalker... Well, that's not the best job, lifting a hand against a fellow Stalker. But the pay is pretty good, and this may be what matters the most.

I'm having a confrontation with this one trader. Well, if he doesn't want to cooperate, then fuck him! But I won't let anyone start filthy rumors. In short, he needs to be wasted so the others don't get out of hand. Let them all know who's the boss here...
Kill the rookie Stalker.
Finish off a rookie Stalker, who may not be a rookie at all... Then who is he? Ah, who cares! As long as the job's not messy.

There's this one guy here loafing about, pretending to be a rookie, but he's rather weird. He's definitely up to something... So anyway, if he suddenly disappears, you'll be doing me a great favor. You know what I mean?
Kill the Stalker called "Fiend".
Eliminate one of the trader Sidorovich's rivals, a Stalker called "Fiend".

"The Fiend", a.k.a. Oleg Gusarov, used to serve in Spetsnaz. As long as he minded his own business, I had nothing against him - a loner is a loner. But I hear he's mustering a gang to crush the cordon and take control over smuggling operations from the Zone. Now this is a major problem and it has to be solved quick. So will you do it?
Kill Father Diodor.
To kill a man preaching in the Zone against gathering and selling artifacts? Exactly.

I always said business and religion can't go together, they can never cross, and should never ever meddle in the other's affairs! It's just this padre, Lord forgive me, Diodor... Well... He just can't see this simple truth. He keeps raving about artifact hunting, says that trading in them drives people to sin not just in the Zone, but in the whole world, on and on along those lines. Get this, he preaches the destruction of artifacts altogether! See what he is up to? The worst bit is that he's actually got some converts! I've tried to approach this Diodor this way and other, but he just keeps at it. Here's the deal: you're going to send him upstairs where he can preach all he likes... You get the point, right? And I'll give you a cool artifact. So, we've got a deal?
Kill the "sales representative".
Kill the "sales representative". The trader is looking after his reputation.

Imagine this: there's some nutjob running around here who introduces himself as my sales representative, uses my reputation, and then tries to hand off second-rate stuff! Broken barrels, armor that's falling apart, expired canned goods. I've already had to deal with a few unhappy clients. Bottom line, I need a man to have a little chat with that "sales representative," whatever it takes.
For the moment there's nothing.
What assignment do you want to talk about?
Assignment is complete - and here is the reward!
And what about the assignment?
There is something:
Nothing for the current moment.
What task do you want to talk about?
Task complete... And here's the reward!
So what's with the task?
There is something:
Bring the jaw of the bloodsucker.
So, the tooth of the bloodsucker brings good luck? Let's see if it'll bring luck to the bloodsucker!

I heard a superstition that the tooth of a bloodsucker brings good luck. As if the one who wears that tooth around his neck gets past the anomalies, and artifacts fall right into his hands. Anyway, it's all bullshit, but there are some dopes who believe it all and are ready to pay well for it. If you bring the jaw of a bloodsucker, I'll pay you well.
Bring over the tail of the pseudodog.
Bring over the tail of the pseudodog.

Winter's coming soon. And what do chicks like to wear there in the Big Land during winter? That's right - furs. So now there's a new fashion going around, making various accessories from the tails of pseudodogs. It's some sort of special fur! Bottom line, there's an order for such a tail. Will you take it?
For the moment there's nothing.
Which assignment do you want to talk about?
Assignment is complete - and here is the reward!
And what about the assignment?
There is something:
I'm here for the job.
I'm not interested in that kind of job.
Some other time.
I'm up for it.
I need a job. Do you have something for me?
For the moment there's nothing.
Which assignment do you want to talk about?
Assignment is complete - and here is the reward!
And what about the assignment?
There is something:
There's no job right now.
What job do you want to talk about?
Job's done... And here's the reward!
What about the job?
Here's something:
For the moment there's nothing.
Which assignment do you want to talk about?
Assignment is complete - and here is the reward!
And what about the assignment?
There is something:
For the moment there's nothing.
Which assignment do you want to talk about?
Assignment is complete - and here is the reward!
And what about the assignment?
There is something:
Destroy the boar lair.
The boars made a lair next to the place where Wolf and his friend made a stash. Wolf asks to purge the lair, and promised to handsomely reward you.

My friend and I had a stash here not far from the car park, where the forest is more dense. Basically, just what you need. But recently the boars made a lair there, and now we can't get to the stash. Help - kill the boars, and I'll thank you, for myself and for my friend.
Destroy the mutants at the farm.
Wolf asks to purge the farm of mutants, as he wants to set up an outpost camp there.

Though this is the border of the Zone, newbies have it tough even here. The bandits are only half the problem - at least they understand Russian. But the mutants - it's really tough with them. They made themselves a lair at the abandoned farm, took over the only good place for an outpost camp. If you manage to purge the mutants from the farm, I'll owe you.
Have a enhanced Novice outfit
Wolf can enhance Novice outfit. Bring one so he can help.
Thank you for your help with the Bandits. I can help you enhance Novice outfit. So just bring them in I am more than happy to help.
Have a enhanced Bandit outfit
Wolf can enhance Novice outfit. Bring one so he can help.
I can also help you enhance Bandit outfit. So just bring them in I am more than happy to help.
Purge the dog lair.
There's a pack of dogs by the south checkpoint at the Bar. The head of the checkpoint asks to purge their lair. Promises a reward.
Despite our efforts, some monsters still manage to break through from the Garbage. Well, you yourself probably saw a pack of dogs to the south of us. If you kill them you'll get a reward.
Purge the dog lair
There's a pack of dogs by the South checkpoint at the Bar. The head of the checkpoint asks to purge their lair. Promises to reward.
Despite our efforts, some monsters still manage to break through from the Garbage. Well you yourself probably saw a pack of dogs to the south of us. If you kill them you'll get a reward.
Camp defense.
transmitted to you (no need for return).
I do not want that task.
